TopicTitle: how do you caculate impact tolerance?

Articles.Content: We\'ll use a fuel tank as a example. The fuel tank has a impact tolerance of 6. does this mean that the fuel tank can handle hitting the ground at 6 meters per second, or does this mean something else?
Yep. It means that the tank can survive hitting the ground at up to 6 meters per second.
I never thought to check the stats for tolerance and just had a rule of thumb under 5 m/s is a must. I\'ll remember that next time!
